We have updated the out-of-box experience for our new LIFX, LIFX + and LIFX Z products. And by popular request we've improved reporting of light connectivity on your local Wi-Fi network. We'd love to know what you think - what's your most wanted feature? Send your feedback to support@lifx.co. Thanks!

The new LIFX + light helps night vision cameras see in the dark! Check out the new "eye" icon on the Colors and Whites screen to see when your LIFX + infrared illumination is on.

Also new in this version: look for lightning-fast display of lights and groups on the main lights list, where we've improved performance to speed up icon updates, increase battery life and maximize network reliability.

Recent firmware updates: We've improved color blending at low brightness on the new LIFX and LIFX + lights to resolve a "flicker" when turning the color wheel and increased fine-tuning of custom colors and whites. Also on new LIFX and LIFX + lights we have resolved an intermittent cloud disconnection issue which caused some schedules and other cloud-controlled events from executing.

Tell us how we're doing at support@lifx.co.

For those with a LIFX Z, we have upgraded Themes so colors are nicely displayed on our newest multi-color light strip. We've also squashed a bug where some popular 3rd-party apps like Light DJ, LIFX Ambience and Lightbow were conflicting with the LIFX app when running in the background, making local Wi-Fi lights inaccessible. And if you have a White-only LIFX light and noticed your warm/cool/brightness tuning screen was temporarily hidden (whoops!) its now restored in all its glory once again.

Also added recently: The new LIFX + light helps night vision cameras see in the dark! Check out the new "eye" icon on the Colors and Whites screen to see when your LIFX + infrared illumination is on.

There's also some recent firmware updates available for the new LIFX and LIFX + lights, which your app will automatically offer to install. Do check them out! We've improved color blending at low brightness to resolve a "flicker" when turning the color wheel and increased fine-tuning of custom colors and whites. And we have resolved an intermittent cloud disconnection issue which caused some schedules and other cloud-controlled events from executing.

Got any more requests? Tell us how we're doing at support@lifx.co.

We have released a firmware update for the new LIFX Z light strip, the Color 1000 and all our tunable White-only products. This improves network connectivity and installation, especially on crowded Wi-Fi networks with patchy internet connections. We have also improved color calibration on the LIFX Z, for richer and more consistent colors across the light strip and our other color products.

Also added recently: The new LIFX + light helps night vision cameras see in the dark! Check out the new "eye" icon on the Colors and Whites screen to see when your LIFX + infrared illumination is on.

And in v3.6.6 we squashed bugs where some favorites were missing and lights unreachable when first opening the app.

There's also some recent firmware updates available for the new LIFX and LIFX + lights, which your app will automatically offer to install. Do check them out! We've improved color blending at low brightness to resolve a "flicker" when turning the color wheel and increased fine-tuning of custom colors and whites. Additionally, we have resolved an intermittent cloud disconnection issue which prevented some schedules and other cloud-controlled events from executing.

Tell us how we're doing at support@lifx.co.

We've added a new effect to animate your LIFX lights and strips, great for the holidays! We have fixed an issue with the brightness wheel not updating smoothly. The app has also been translated into the Italian language.

What's your most wanted feature? Tell us at: support@lifx.co.

WHATS NEW: iOS 3.7.0

We have restyled the lights list with a fresh new look. Lights now appear as a familiar power icon - tap a light to quickly toggle power on and off. For full control of Colors, Whites, Themes and Effects tap the caption below a light's power icon. Also on the lights list, all sections like " My Lights", "My Groups" and "Integrations" can be hidden/restored with a tap. Let us know your feedback on this new look!

Also in this update: Bem-vindo ao LIFX! We've added a Portuguese app translation, added a Brightness setting to the new Animate Theme effect, and slipped in some nice performance and reliability fixes.

For LIFX +, we have added new night vision controls. Tap a light's name then go to Edit > Night Vision to set invisible infrared illumination for night vision cameras to off, medium or full brightness. For extra security, you must be logged in to the LIFX account that owns a light to change this setting.

For LIFX Z, you can now save and restore multicolor scenes on your light strips. When you have finished painting your color masterpiece, tap "+" on the main lights list, choose New Scene, make sure your LIFX Z strip is selected and hit Save. Re-apply your colors with a single tap under the Scenes list, by an automatic recurring Schedule or via your favorite connection like Alexa or IFTTT.

With Multitasking on iPad, you can use more than one app at a time. Back by popular demand, weve restored support LIFX for this - thanks for letting know you loved this feature! See https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT202070 for more info on Multitasking on your iPad.

Widgets are a great way to control your favorite lights even when your phone is locked. Weve tweaked our widgets to ensure at least 8 items fit on all devices. Favorite any Light, Group or Scene by tapping its star icon and check out https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT207122 to learn how to use Widgets on iOS.

For Apple Watch users, weve fixed a bug where the LIFX app was not always syncing correctly with the Watch.

Weve also fixed a crash when restoring multi-color scenes for LIFX Z strips, improved feedback during firmware update progress and added better support for viewing the Getting Started walkthrough on rotated devices.

Other recent updates include:

Restyled the lights list with a fresh new look. Lights now appear as a familiar power icon - tap a light to quickly toggle power on and off. For full control of Colors, Whites, Themes and Effects tap the caption below a light's power icon. Also on the lights list, all sections like " My Lights", "My Groups" and "Integrations" can be hidden/restored with a tap. Let us know your feedback on this new look!

Bem-vindo ao LIFX! We've added a Portuguese app translation, added a Brightness setting to the new Animate Theme effect, and slipped in some nice performance and reliability fixes.

For LIFX +, we have added new night vision controls. Tap a light's name then go to Edit > Night Vision to set invisible infrared illumination for night vision cameras to off, medium or full brightness. For extra security, you must be logged in to the LIFX account that owns a light to change this setting.

For LIFX Z, you can now save and restore multicolor scenes on your light strips. When you have finished painting your color masterpiece, tap "+" on the main lights list, choose New Scene, make sure your LIFX Z strip is selected and hit Save. Re-apply your colors with a single tap under the Scenes list, by an automatic recurring Schedule or via your favorite connection like Alexa or IFTTT.

This release brings improvements and updates to some of your favorite LIFX effects:

Color Cycle Effect
Fresh improvements to the Color Cycle effect now let you move your lights through every possible color. Just select your speed and color variation.

Music Visualizer
Get ready to through the best party in town. Your lights will now be more accurate when changing based on the tone of the music youre playing. It will also detect the beat in the song and change the brightness.

NEW: Pastel Effect
Your LIFX can now rotate colors on a low saturation value, so that you can get pastel colors that will adjust even better to the mood you want to create.

*All effects updates include Multi Zone support on your LIFX Z as well, which means that the effect will run through all of your color zones now.

Other recent updates:

- A new notifications screen.
- All issues around Widgets have been resolved.
- Bugs fixes.

LIFX is proudly now Apple HomeKit enabled for new and existing LIFX and LIFX+ products.
Improvements:
-Stability and connectivity across all products
-Firmware update process streamlined and simplified
-Japanese language support
-Night Vision brightness for LIFX+ products can be configured in 'Schedules'
-Music Visualizer is now more dynamic and responsive
Fixed:
Music Visualizer becoming unresponsive for some users

- Turning on the Day Dusk feature will now start the transition straight away.
- Touching the Day Dusk graph will allow you to preview the Day Dusk transition directly on your lights.
- Day Dusk Evening to Night Light transition has been refined so they lights won't get darker until closer to the Night Light segment begins.
- If Day Dusk is switched on for a group, there are now status indicators when you look at lights in that group on the dashboard or the Day Dusk screen.
- We've also updated our app icon, fixed some crashes that were occurring with the music visualiser, made some improvements in the reliability of setting up HomeKit, fixed a bug where the marketing sections closed state wasn't being persisted correctly and added a white only strobe option.

- The Create tab has been redesigned to bring a brand new painting experience to the Tile, Beam and LIFX Z.
- Each of these multi-zone products will now show a multi-color arc on the dashboard instead of just a single colour.
-The Tile also now utilizes its hardware accelerometer to always present the image in the right alignment regardless of how they are positioned on the wall.
- There is now a setting in the Edit Light menu for LIFX Z and Beam to reverse the UI.

- Improvements to reliability of communication with lights.
- Improvement to caching of light information to improve app startup experience.
- Themes now take into account light brightness, and will never become brighter than the current light brightness.
- Improvement to the brightness changing behavior on Multi-Zone products and Tile. When a Theme is applied, brightness will scale rather than setting all LEDs to the same brightness.
- Added support for expanded Kelvin range on Mini Color and Mini Day Dusk.
- Fixed issue where the Day Dusk icon on the Dashboard was inaccurate when a light was moved to a different group.
- Fixed bug where color links couldn't be pasted.
- Fixed issue where the app didn't log out after the user had revoked access to the account.
